intro: Caryomene prumnoides, commonly known as the blackwood tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, including South Africa, where it typically grows in coastal forests and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its dark, almost black bark and small, opposite leaves. It produces small yellow flowers followed by elliptical, woody fruits. Caryomene prumnoides is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
